title: Appointment of agent; collection or repossession
context: §476-18 Appointment of agent; collection or repossession. No provision in a credit sale contract by which the buyer executes a power of attorney appointing the seller or holder of the contract, or other person acting on the buyer&rsquo;s behalf, as the buyer&rsquo;s agent in collection of payments under the contract or in the repossession of the goods shall be enforceable. [L 1961, c 102, pt of §1; Supp, §201A-16; HRS §476-17; am and ren L 1984, c 86, pt of §1]
